reviews.title: Good location, rooms average, but ok for the price
reviews.text: We stayed two first nights in Italy here. Definetely not a disappointed,
but not a good surprise. Average. Location is fine, breakfast served
reviews.title: Good Value for the Money

reviews.text: in roof-top terrace was located nicely, but the breakfast itself was
reviews.title: A lovely hotel in a great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: a really average.
reviews.title: QUERKY, QUIET, CLEAN AND CLOSE TO CENTRE

reviews.text: Hotel Canova staff was very friendly and helpful, rooms were small but very comfortable. The small elevator was a source of constant amusement for my teenage daughters, as it will only accommodate two smallish people.
reviews.title: Terrible - do not stay here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel was in an excellent location, close to colleseum. The staff were very helpful. Hotel was clean and well kept. Breakfast on roof terrace, lovely. However not much selection of juices. Only downside. We had a lovely stay.
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.text: Nice hotel with very responsive staff. Very small rooms but good enough ti sleep on a comfortable bed with air cond. Breakfast are okay: ham cheese bread toasts jams pastries musli tea coffee juices (not fresh). Breakfast is served on the roof which is very very cool! In the eve there was nobody on the roof, so we bought a bottle of wine procuitto and parmezan and had a romantic dinner. Receiptionist gave us two wine glasses and was ready to help. Minuses: we had broken frigde in our room. The promised to fix it as we are going to check in again in two days. So, will update my comment
reviews.title: Nice hotel with romantic roof!

reviews.text: We chose Hotel Canova as a place for the 5 of us to meet in Rome. It was a mature couple and 3 adult age children. We took 2 rooms for 3 days. The triple room was really a large double with another bed -- a bit cramped for 3 20 somethings -- but they didn't spend that much time in the room anyway.
reviews.title: Nice basic hotel in Rome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel was walking distance from Termini train station -- probably 300 metres. On arrival we took the B train to Cavour street (as recommended by the hotel website) -- it was VERY crowded and hot -- not a good experience when you're dragging bags around. I'd recommend walking or a cab (about $10 euros).
reviews.title: Definitely satisfied!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff was friendly with good English, and communications prior to arrival were good.
reviews.title: Very pleased, good price from Rome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you need high-end pampering and a gym, look elsewhere. If you're fine with convenient, comfortable and friendly for a decent price, this is your place.
reviews.title: Pleasant hotel, decent price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room is small and a little dark, but the bed is comfortable, and there's a minibar, room safe, and clean, modern bathroom. Just fine for our three days in Rome. Not a super-touristy area which is nice, but a very good selection of restaurants nearby, and excellent gelato a short walk away (and a laundromat too).
reviews.title: A solid choice

reviews.text: Cheery breakfast room on the top floor, and the breakfast offerings more than adequate, including plenty of fresh croissants. Nice rooftop terrace where we took our bottle of wine (brought from outside) and borrowed wine glasses (from the bar in the lobby) in the evening. Staff will also bring drinks from the lobby bar to the rooftop for you. Very accommodating and friendly staff, especially Andrea on the front desk and Carmine in the breakfast room.
reviews.title: Great location, very nice hotel
Lovely hotel in a perfect location
reviews.text: Wi-fi available in lobby only, but is free.
Only down side was low water pressure in our 4th floor shower (the hotel has 5 floors) during the pre-breakfast hours. Take your shower very early or after breakfast.
reviews.title: Very Satisfied

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in hotel at end of may and were very impressed. The hotel is in a good location on a quiet street but stil within walking distance of all the sights. The room a decent size for Europe, with modern clean well equipped bathrooms. The reception staff were friendly and helpful. We had breakfast on the roof every day and had no complaints about standard in coffee was wonderful. When you compare the price to other hotels its amazing how good value it is.
reviews.title: Great find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 4 nights in this hotel. Its simple and clean. Rooms cleaned and every night but even if we put our towels on the floor they were not changed. But there were soaps and shampoo in the bathroom, a bidé and good shower.
reviews.title: just what you need in a city break hotel

reviews.text: We stayed on the 3rd floor with window to the inner courtyard so it wasn't very noisy, but as I am a light sleeper I always bring earplugs. Our travel companions stayed on the 2nd floor with window to the street and found it very noisy. Breakfast was fine: toasts, yoghurts, juices, good coffee (we asked the very nice breakfast-lady to make us caffe-latte in the kitchen) and sweets. The only thing I missed was some fresh fruit. All reception-staff friendly. The only thing I didn't like was the headboard, old-fashioned covered in fabric. Find it a bit unhygienic.. And for staying in central Rome you pay more for this hotel than a similar further from city center.
reviews.title: Perfect location and value for your money

reviews.text: I have visited the Eternal city over a dozen times in the last ten years and came across this hotel for this trip. perfect,especially if u realise all hotel rooms in Rome are boxs and only used as a base to stop off or sleep. EASILY the best value (and shower) we have stayed in for the price, cleanleness,helpfulness and location. Our new base from mow on.
reviews.title: cute, convenient & cost effective

reviews.text: Staff was really willing to help us, especially the receptionist called Fabio gave us really accurate information about the district, the distances and the right places to visit and to eat, in reasonable prices (2 meal course with bottle of wine and dessert about 40 euro).
reviews.title: Not far from Metro and Train Station, but far from main tourist attraction.
